page.title: 14Give our Bobby back:FINTRY
page.content:
{A generation ago locked doors were a {rarity.}Even a decade ago one hardly ever locked a garage or garden shed. Now it is essential.{Five break-ins {are not bad as the national average {goes,}but they are a disaster for us.
{Two single man patrol cars per shift {in Western Stirlingshire.}The chaps are nice enough and are called on radios when a 999 is made. It still seems a poor substitute for our own village bobby, no matter how it is explained away.{He quietly seemed to {know what was going on, more a friend {than the Fuzz to young folk.}It isn't nostalgia, and it could be cheaper.
So please Mister, how about selling a computer or three, may be even a couple of cars and{let us have our own {Bobby again.
